javaslang.concurrent

Class Future<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javaslang.concurrent.Future<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of this Future's eventual value.

    public class Future<T>
extends Object
    Futures represent asynchronous computations that will result in a value at some unknown point in the future. Methods on Future return new Futures that will perform their operations or call backs when the value is available.

    See Promise if you want Futures that can be success by some other method.

    Since:
    2.0.0

      • Future

        public Future(Try.CheckedSupplier<T> source,
              Executor ex)
        Create a new Future who's value will be calculated asynchronously from the given Supplier
        Parameters:
        source - A Supplier that will asynchronously provide the final value.
        ex - An Executor that will be used to calculate the value of the supplier and will serve as the default Executor for all asynchronous methods on this Future.

      • of

        public static <T> Future<T> of(CompletableFuture<? extends T> source)
        A static form of Future(CompletableFuture) and is identical.

        See Future(CompletableFuture).

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:
        source - a source CompletableFuture
        Returns:
        a new Future

      • of

        public static <T> Future<T> of(Future<? extends T> source)
        Create a new Future based on a Future. Not recommended, as a thread must be used poll for a response. Only use when necessary to bridge legacy apis that use Future. If there is any way to use a Promise instead, do that.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The Type of both Futures.
        Parameters:
        source - A Future to fulfil this Future.
        Returns:
        A new Future that will poll and wait for the result of the given Future.

        public static <T> Future<T> success(T obj)
        Create a new Future that is already finished with the given value.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of obj.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • map

        public <R> Future<R> map(Function<? super T,? extends R> func,
                         Executor ex)
        Creates a new Future by applying a function to the successful result of this Future. If this Future fails with an exception the resulting Future will contain the same exception instead.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The result type of the Function
        Parameters:
        func - Function to apply to the result
        ex - Executor to use for this operation. Becomes the default Executor for the resulting Future.
        Returns:
        A new Future who's value will be calculated with the supplied function once this Future's result is evaluated.

      • forEach

        public void forEach(Consumer<? super T> func,
                    Executor ex)
        Asynchronously processes the value in the future once the value becomes available. Will not be called if the future fails. Identical to onSuccess(Consumer, Executor).
        Parameters:
        func - Function to be applied when the Future completes.
        ex - Executor to use for this operation.

      • forEach

        public void forEach(Consumer<? super T> func)
        Asynchronously processes the value in the future once the value becomes available. Will not be called if the future fails. Identical to onSuccess(Consumer).
        Parameters:
        func - Function to be applied when the Future completes.

      • failed

        public Future<Throwable> failed(Executor ex)
        Returns a failed projection of this future. The failed projection is a future holding a value of type Throwable. It is success with a value which is the throwable of the original future in case the original future is failed. It is failed with a NoSuchElementException if the original future is success successfully.
        Parameters:
        ex - Executor to use for this operation. Becomes the default Executor for the resulting Future.
        Returns:
        A failed projection of this future.

      • failed

        public Future<Throwable> failed()
        Returns a failed projection of this future. The failed projection is a future holding a value of type Throwable. It is success with a value which is the throwable of the original future in case the original future is failed. It is failed with a NoSuchElementException if the original future is success successfully.
        Returns:
        A failed projection of this future.

      • onCompleted

        public void onCompleted(Consumer<? super T> success,
                        Consumer<Throwable> failure,
                        Executor ex)
        Asynchronously processes the value in the future once the value becomes available. Either success or failure will be called.
        Parameters:
        success - Function to be applied if the Future completes successfully.
        failure - Function to be applied if the Future completes with an exception.
        ex - Executor to use for this operation.

      • onCompleted

        public void onCompleted(Consumer<? super T> success,
                        Consumer<Throwable> failure)
        Asynchronously processes the value in the future once the value becomes available. Either success or failure will be called.
        Parameters:
        success - Function to be applied if the Future completes successfully.
        failure - Function to be applied if the Future completes with an exception.

      • filter

        public Future<T> filter(Predicate<? super T> func,
                        Executor ex)
        Creates a new Future by applying a predicate to the successful result of this Future. If the value fails the test the resulting Future will contain a NoSuchElementException. Otherwise it will be the same value. If this Future fails with an exception the resulting Future will contain the same exception instead.
        Parameters:
        func - Function to apply to the result
        ex - Executor to use for this operation. Becomes the default Executor for the resulting Future.
        Returns:
        A new Future who's value will be calculated with the supplied function once this Future's result is evaluated.

      • filter

        public Future<T> filter(Predicate<? super T> func)
        Creates a new Future by applying a predicate to the successful result of this Future. If the value fails the test the resulting Future will contain a NoSuchElementException. Otherwise it will be the same value. If this Future fails with an exception the resulting Future will contain the same exception instead.
        Parameters:
        func - Function to apply to the result
        Returns:
        A new Future who's value will be calculated with the supplied function once this Future's result is evaluated.

      • andThen

        public Future<T> andThen(Consumer<? super Try<T>> func,
                         Executor ex)
        Applies the side-effecting function to the result of this future, and returns a new future with the result of this future. This method allows one to enforce that the callbacks are executed in a specified order. Note that if one of the chained andThen callbacks throws an exception, that exception is not propagated to the subsequent andThen callbacks. Instead, the subsequent andThen callbacks are given the original value of this future.
        Parameters:
        func - Function to apply to the result
        ex - Executor to use for this operation. Becomes the default Executor for the resulting Future.
        Returns:
        A new Future who's value will be calculated with the supplied function once this Future's result is evaluated.

      • andThen

        public Future<T> andThen(Consumer<? super Try<T>> func)
        Applies the side-effecting function to the result of this future, and returns a new future with the result of this future. This method allows one to enforce that the callbacks are executed in a specified order. Note that if one of the chained andThen callbacks throws an exception, that exception is not propagated to the subsequent andThen callbacks. Instead, the subsequent andThen callbacks are given the original value of this future.
        Parameters:
        func - Function to apply to the result
        Returns:
        A new Future who's value will be calculated with the supplied function once this Future's result is evaluated.

      • isCompleted

        public boolean isCompleted()
        Returns:
        If this Future has finished.

      • isSuccess

        public boolean isSuccess()
        Returns:
        If this Future has finished AND contains a Success.

      • isFailure

        public boolean isFailure()
        Returns:
        If this Future has finished AND contains a Failure.

      • value

        public Option<Try<T>> value()
        Returns:
        The resulting value of this Future. Will be None until the Future finishes. After finishing, it will be a Some of either Success or Failure.

      • await

        public Future<T> await(long timeOut,
                       TimeUnit unit)
                throws InterruptedException,
                       TimeoutException
        Block and wait for this Future to finish. Not recommended.
        Parameters:
        timeOut - Time to wait
        unit - TimeUnit that timeOut is in.
        Returns:
        this, but after blocking until success.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if unit.timedWait gets interrupted
        TimeoutException - if a timeout occurs

      • ready

        public Try<T> ready(long timeOut,
                    TimeUnit unit)
             throws InterruptedException,
                    TimeoutException
        Block and wait for this Future to finish. Not recommended.
        Parameters:
        timeOut - Time to wait
        unit - TimeUnit that timeOut is in.
        Returns:
        The result value of this Future after blocking.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if await gets interrupted
        TimeoutException - if a timeout occurs

      • fallbackTo

        public Future<T> fallbackTo(Future<T> that)
        Returns a new Future which will take the result of #that if and only if this Future fails.
        Parameters:
        that - An alternative value.
        Returns:
        a new Future
